sentence.idiomatic: These snacks look delicious.
She doesn't look very happy today.
This painting looks very valuable.
He is quite unusual--he hardly ever speaks.
I don't see what is so special about this skirt.
She is all dressed up today, maybe she has something important to do.
This book is extremely well-written.
He plays basketball extremely well.
The things at that shop are ultra-expensive.
It was so hot outside today, I was totally sweating.
I just fell down. It hurt so much it made me cry.
Which way does the water in this river flow?
We've agreed on it today. When the time comes you can't have any regrets.
He's coming to Shanghai to give a concert next month. When he comes let's go see it together.
This problem isn't urgent. When the time comes we'll discuss it again.
Where in Taiwan are you from?
Taipei.
Oh, that's quite a nice city.
Yeah, there is the Taipei 101 building. It's the tallest building in Taiwan. It's very unique-looking.
I've heard the night markets are really good too.
Yeah, the snacks are so great.
My mouth is watering. Have you been to the National Palace Museum?
Yes, I have, it's a museum.
I really want to go to Taipei to see it.
When you come I'll treat you to some snacks.
